subject: [Radiance-general] Re: Preparing an open DXF file for imporReferences: <hm6phj$hhr$1@dough.gmane.org> <4B875E19.5000003@gmx.net>
body:
<hmc31k$r3u$1@dough.gmane.org> <4B89E7CD.7010301@gmx.net>
Message-ID: <hmehcg$m6u$1@dough.gmane.org>


Thanks for the summary, the confirmation of my intuition, & the cite of
brl-cad, which I'd only vaguely been aware of.

I think it might be possible to get around Autodesk's restrictions by
writing a script that would run in the AutoCAD environment. Such a
script, I think, could directly create files in an export format. It
would have to be quite a script, though!

Randolph
